  11# ######################## PIMU #################################
  12
  13"""
  14The PIMU is the power and IMU Arduino board in the base
  15"""
  16
  17
  18class IMUBase(Device):
  19    """
  20    API to the Stretch IMU found in the base
  21    """
  22    def __init__(self):
  23        Device.__init__(self, 'imu',req_params=False)
  24        #pitch; //-180 to 180, rolls over
  25        #roll; //-90 to  90, rolls over at 180
  26        #heading; //0-360.0, rolls over
  27        self.status={'ax':0,'ay':0,'az':0,'gx':0,'gy':0,'gz':0,'mx':0,'my':0,'mz':0,'roll':0,'pitch':0,'heading':0,'timestamp':0,'qw':0,'qx':0,'qy':0,'qz':0,'bump':0}
  28
  29    def get_status(self):
  30        """Returns a copy of the internal status.
  31
  32        Returns
  33        -------
  34        dict:
  35            A copy of the internal status dictionary containing IMU status.
  36        """
  37        s=self.status.copy()
  38        return s
  39
  40    def get_quaternion(self):
  41        """Returns the quaternion values representing the IMU's orientation.
  42
  43        Returns
  44        -------
  45        list:
  46            A list containing the quaternion values.
  47        """
  48        return [self.status['qw'],self.status['qx'],self.status['qy'],self.status['qz']]

  51    def pretty_print(self):
  52        """Prints a representation of the IMU's status.
  53        """
  54        print('----------IMU -------------')
  55        print('AX (m/s^2)', self.status['ax'])
  56        print('AY (m/s^2)', self.status['ay'])
  57        print('AZ (m/s^2)', self.status['az'])
  58        print('GX (rad/s)', self.status['gx'])
  59        print('GY (rad/s)', self.status['gy'])
  60        print('GZ (rad/s)', self.status['gz'])
  61        print('MX (uTesla)', self.status['mx'])
  62        print('MY (uTesla)', self.status['my'])
  63        print('MZ (uTesla)', self.status['mz'])
  64        print('QW', self.status['qw'])
  65        print('QX', self.status['qx'])
  66        print('QY', self.status['qy'])
  67        print('QZ', self.status['qz'])
  68        print('Roll (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['roll']))
  69        print('Pitch (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['pitch']))
  70        print('Heading (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['heading']))
  71        print('Bump', self.status['bump'])
  72        print('Timestamp (s)', self.status['timestamp'])
  73        print('-----------------------')

  76        """@private"""
  77        raise NotImplementedError('This method not supported by IMU for firmware.')

  79# ######################## IMU PROTOCOL P0 #################################
  80class IMU_Protocol_P0(IMUBase):
  81    def unpack_status(self, s):
  82        """Unpacks status information and updated the `self.status` dictionary.
  83
  84        Parameters
  85        ----------
  86        s : bytes.
  87            A byte array containing packed status information.
  88
  89        Returns
  90        -------
  91        int:
  92            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
  93        """
  94        # take in an array of bytes
  95        # this needs to exactly match the C struct format
  96        sidx=0
  97        self.status['ax']=  unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
  98        self.status['ay'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
  99        self.status['az'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 100        self.status['gx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 101        self.status['gy'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 102        self.status['gz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 103        self.status['mx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 104        self.status['my'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 105        self.status['mz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 106        self.status['roll'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 107        self.status['pitch'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 108        self.status['heading'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 109        self.status['qw'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 110        self.status['qx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 111        self.status['qy'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 112        self.status['qz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 113        self.status['bump'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 114        self.status['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 115        return sidx
 116
 117# ######################## IMU PROTOCOL P1 #################################
 118class IMU_Protocol_P1(IMUBase):
 119    def unpack_status(self, s):
 120        """Unpacks status information and updated the `self.status` dictionary.
 121
 122        Parameters
 123        ----------
 124        s : bytes.
 125            A byte array containing packed status information.
 126
 127        Returns
 128        -------
 129        int:
 130            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
 131        """
 132        # take in an array of bytes
 133        # this needs to exactly match the C struct format
 134        sidx=0
 135        self.status['ax']=  unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 136        self.status['ay'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 137        self.status['az'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 138        self.status['gx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 139        self.status['gy'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 140        self.status['gz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 141        self.status['mx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 142        self.status['my'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 143        self.status['mz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 144        self.status['roll'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 145        self.status['pitch'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 146        self.status['heading'] = deg_to_rad(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 4
 147        self.status['qw'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 148        self.status['qx'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 149        self.status['qy'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 150        self.status['qz'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 151        self.status['bump'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 152        return sidx

 154# ######################## IMU #################################
 155class IMU(IMUBase):
 156    def __init__(self):
 157        IMUBase.__init__(self)
 158        # Order in descending order so more recent protocols/methods override less recent
 159        self.supported_protocols = {'p0': (IMU_Protocol_P0,), 'p1': (IMU_Protocol_P1,IMU_Protocol_P0,),
 160                                    'p2': (IMU_Protocol_P1,IMU_Protocol_P0,),'p3': (IMU_Protocol_P1,IMU_Protocol_P0,)}
 161

 269    def __init__(self, event_reset=False, usb=None):
 270        Device.__init__(self, 'pimu')
 271        self.config = self.params['config']
 272        self.imu = IMU()
 273        self._dirty_config = True
 274        self._dirty_trigger = False
 275        self.frame_id_last = None
 276        self.frame_id_base = 0
 277        if usb is None:
 278            usb = self.params['usb_name']
 279        self.transport = Transport(usb=usb, logger=self.logger)
 280        self.status = {'voltage': 0, 'current': 0, 'temp': 0,'cpu_temp': 0, 'cliff_range':[0,0,0,0], 'frame_id': 0,
 281                       'timestamp': 0,'at_cliff':[False,False,False,False], 'runstop_event': False, 'bump_event_cnt': 0,
 282                       'cliff_event': False, 'fan_on': False, 'buzzer_on': False, 'low_voltage_alert':False,'high_current_alert':False,'over_tilt_alert':False,
 283                       'charger_connected':False, 'boot_detected':False,'imu': self.imu.status,'debug':0,'state':0,'trace_on':0,
 284                       'motor_sync_rate': 0, 'motor_sync_cnt': 0, 'motor_sync_queues': 0, 'motor_sync_drop': 0,
 285                       'transport': self.transport.status}
 286
 287        self.status_zero=self.status.copy()
 288        self.status_aux = {'foo': 0}
 289
 290        self._trigger=0
 291        self.ts_last_fan_on=None
 292        self.fan_on_last=False
 293        #Reset PIMU state so that Ctrl-C and re-instantiate Pimu class is efficient way to get out of an event
 294        if event_reset:
 295            self.runstop_event_reset()
 296            self.cliff_event_reset()
 297
 298        self.board_info = {'board_variant': None, 'firmware_version': None, 'protocol_version': None,'hardware_id':0}
 299        self.hw_valid = False
 300        self.ts_last_motor_sync=None
 301        self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn=None
 302        self.load_test_payload = arr.array('B', range(256)) * 4
 303        self.ts_get_cpu_temp=0
 304        self.get_cpu_temp()

 306    # ###########  Device Methods #############
 307
 308    def startup(self, threaded=False):
 309        try:
 310            Device.startup(self, threaded=threaded)
 311            self.hw_valid = self.transport.startup()
 312            if self.hw_valid:
 313                payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_BOARD_INFO])
 314                self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_board_info_reply)
 315                self.transport.configure_version(self.board_info['firmware_version'])
 316                return True
 317            return False
 318        except KeyError:
 319            self.hw_valid =False
 320            return False
 321
 322
 323    def stop(self):
 324        Device.stop(self)
 325        if not self.hw_valid:
 326            return
 327        self.set_fan_off()
 328        self.push_command(exiting=True)
 329        self.transport.stop()
 330        self.hw_valid = False
 331
 332    def set_config(self,c):
 333        """Set the configuration.
 334
 335        Parameters
 336        ----------
 337        c : dict.
 338            A dictionary containing the configuration settings.
 339        """
 340        self.config=c.copy()
 341        self._dirty_config = True
 342
 343    def pull_status(self, exiting=False):
 344        """Pull the status information from the hardware synchronously
 345        """
 346        if not self.hw_valid:
 347            return
 348        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_STATUS])
 349        self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_status_reply)
 350
 351    async def pull_status_async(self, exiting=False):
 352        """Pull the status information from the hardware asynchronosly
 353        """
 354        if not self.hw_valid:
 355            return
 356        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_STATUS])
 357        await self.transport.do_pull_rpc_async(payload, self.rpc_status_reply, exiting=exiting)
 358
 359    async def push_command_async(self, exiting=False):
 360        """Push a command to the hardware asynchronously
 361        """
 362        if not self.hw_valid:
 363            return
 364        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
 365        if self._dirty_config:
 366            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
 367            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
 368            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
 369            self._dirty_config = False
 370
 371        if self._dirty_trigger:
 372            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
 373            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
 374            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
 375            self._trigger = 0
 376            self._dirty_trigger = False
 377
 378    def push_command(self, exiting=False):
 379        """Push a command to the hardware synchronously
 380        """
 381        if not self.hw_valid:
 382            return
 383        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
 384        if self._dirty_config:
 385            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
 386            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
 387            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
 388            self._dirty_config = False
 389
 390        if self._dirty_trigger:
 391            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
 392            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
 393            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
 394            self._trigger = 0
 395            self._dirty_trigger = False
 396
 397    def pretty_print(self):
 398        """Pretty print the status information of the Pimu.
 399        """
 400        print('------ Pimu -----')
 401        print('Voltage',self.status['voltage'])
 402        print('Current', self.status['current'])
 403        print('CPU Temp',self.status['cpu_temp'])
 404        print('Board Temp', self.status['temp'])
 405        print('State', self.status['state'])
 406        print('At Cliff', self.status['at_cliff'])
 407        print('Cliff Range', self.status['cliff_range'])
 408        print('Cliff Event', self.status['cliff_event'])
 409        print('Runstop Event', self.status['runstop_event'])
 410        print('Bump Event Cnt', self.status['bump_event_cnt'])
 411        print('Fan On', self.status['fan_on'])
 412        print('Buzzer On', self.status['buzzer_on'])
 413        print('Low Voltage Alert', self.status['low_voltage_alert'])
 414        print('High Current Alert', self.status['high_current_alert'])
 415        print('Over Tilt Alert',self.status['over_tilt_alert'])
 416        print('Trace on:', self.status['trace_on'])
 417        if self.board_info['hardware_id']>0:
 418            print('Charger Connected', self.status['charger_connected'])
 419            print('Boot Detected', self.status['boot_detected'])
 420        print('Debug', self.status['debug'])
 421        print('Timestamp (s)', self.status['timestamp'])
 422        #print('Read error', self.transport.status['read_error'])
 423        print('Queued motor sync', self.status['motor_sync_queues'])
 424        print('Motor sync rate', self.status['motor_sync_rate'])
 425        print('Motor sync cnt', self.status['motor_sync_cnt'])
 426        print('Board variant:',self.board_info['board_variant'])
 427        print('Firmware version:', self.board_info['firmware_version'])
 428        print('Transport version:', self.transport.version)
 429        self.imu.pretty_print()

 431    # ####################### User Functions #######################################################

 433
 434    def runstop_event_reset(self):
 435        """
 436        Reset the robot runstop, allowing motion to continue
 437        """
 438        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_RUNSTOP_RESET
 439        self._dirty_trigger=True
 440
 441    def runstop_event_trigger(self):
 442        """
 443        Trigger the robot runstop, stopping motion
 444        """
 445        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_RUNSTOP_ON
 446        self._dirty_trigger=True
 447
 448    def trigger_beep(self):
 449        """
 450        Generate a single short beep
 451        """
 452        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_BEEP
 453        self._dirty_trigger=True
 454
 455    def trigger_lightbar_test(self):
 456        """Trigger a lghtbar test.
 457        """
 458        self._trigger = self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_LIGHTBAR_TEST
 459        self._dirty_trigger = True
 460
 461    # ####################### Utility functions ####################################################
 462    def imu_reset(self):
 463        """Trigger an IMU reset.
 464        """
 465        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_IMU_RESET
 466        self._dirty_trigger=True
 467
 468
 469    def is_ready_for_sync(self):
 470        """Check if the robot is ready for motor synchronization.
 471
 472        Returns
 473        -------
 474        bool:
 475            True if it's ready for synchronization, False otberwise.
 476        """
 477        # For RE1.0 robots (hardware_id==0) the runstop and sync line are shared
 478        # This limits the maximum rate that the motor sync can be triggered
 479        # For RE2.0 robots the sync rate is limited by the min pulse width (~10ms)
 480        #Track the rate that the sync is triggered
 481        # This is called once prior to issuing stepper push_commands
 482        # If it is True then trigger_motor_sync is safe to call after the push_commands
 483        # By calling it first, it ensures that the sync rate is accurate (eg, not measuring timing of RPC, etc)
 484        t = time.time()
 485        if self.ts_last_motor_sync is not None:
 486            rate=1 / (t - self.ts_last_motor_sync)
 487            if rate>self.params['max_sync_rate_hz']:
 488                self.status['motor_sync_drop'] += 1
 489                if self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn is None or t-self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn>5.0:
 490                    print('Warning: Rate of calls to Pimu:trigger_motor_sync rate of %f above maximum frequency of %.2f Hz. Motor commands dropped: %d'%(rate,self.params['max_sync_rate_hz'],self.status['motor_sync_drop']))
 491                    self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn=t
 492                return False
 493            self.status['motor_sync_rate'] = rate #Only update rate if it is ready
 494        return True
 495
 496    def trigger_motor_sync(self):
 497        """Trigger motor synchronization.
 498        """
 499        #Push out immediately
 500        if not self.hw_valid:
 501            return
 502        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_SET_MOTOR_SYNC])
 503        self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_motor_sync_reply)
 504        self.ts_last_motor_sync = time.time()
 505
 506
 507    def set_fan_on(self):
 508        """Turn the fan on.
 509        """
 510        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_FAN_ON
 511        self._dirty_trigger=True
 512
 513    def set_fan_off(self):
 514        """Turn the fan off.
 515        """
 516        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_FAN_OFF
 517        self._dirty_trigger=True
 518
 519    def set_buzzer_on(self):
 520        """Turn the buzzer on.
 521        """
 522        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_BUZZER_ON
 523        self._dirty_trigger=True
 524
 525    def set_buzzer_off(self):
 526        """Turn the buzzer off.
 527        """
 528        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_BUZZER_OFF
 529        self._dirty_trigger=True
 530
 531    def board_reset(self):
 532        """Reset the board.
 533        """
 534        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_BOARD_RESET
 535        self._dirty_trigger=True
 536
 537    def cliff_event_reset(self):
 538        """Reset the cliff event.
 539        """
 540        self._trigger=self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_CLIFF_EVENT_RESET
 541        self._dirty_trigger=True
 542
 543    # ########### Sensor Calibration #################
 544    def get_voltage(self,raw):
 545        """Convert raw ADC value to voltage.
 546
 547        Parameters
 548        ----------
 549        raw : int.
 550            The raw value.
 551
 552        Returns
 553        -------
 554        float:
 555            The voltage in volts.
 556        """
 557        raw_to_V = 20.0/1024 #10bit adc, 0-20V per 0-3.3V reading
 558        return raw*raw_to_V
 559
 560
 561    def get_temp(self,raw):
 562        """Convert raw value to temperature in degrees Celsius
 563
 564        Parameters
 565        ----------
 566        raw : int.
 567            The raw value.
 568
 569        Returns
 570        -------
 571        float:
 572            The temperature in degrees Celsius.
 573        """
 574        raw_to_mV = 3300/1024.0
 575        mV = raw*raw_to_mV - 400 #400mV at 0C per spec
 576        C = mV/19.5 #19.5mV per C per spec
 577        return C
 578
 579    def get_current(self,raw):
 580        """Convert raw value to current in amperes.
 581
 582        Parameters
 583        ----------
 584        raw : int.
 585            The raw value.
 586
 587        Returns
 588        -------
 589        float:
 590            The current in amperes.
 591        """
 592        raw_to_mV = 3300 / 1024.0
 593        mV = raw * raw_to_mV
 594        mA = mV/.408 # conversion per circuit
 595        return mA/1000.0
 596    # ################Data Packing #####################
 597
 598    def unpack_board_info(self,s):
 599        """Unpack board information from a byte array.
 600
 601        Parameters
 602        ----------
 603        s : bytes.
 604            The byte array containing board information.
 605
 606        Returns
 607        -------
 608        int:
 609            The index #### NEED TO CHECK #####
 610        """
 611        sidx=0
 612        self.board_info['board_variant'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
 613        self.board_info['hardware_id'] = 0
 614        if len(self.board_info['board_variant'])==6: #New format of Pimu.x Older format of Pimu.BoardName.Vx' If older format,default to 0
 615            self.board_info['hardware_id']=int(self.board_info['board_variant'][-1])
 616        sidx += 20
 617        self.board_info['firmware_version'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
 618        self.board_info['protocol_version'] = self.board_info['firmware_version'][self.board_info['firmware_version'].rfind('p'):]
 619        sidx += 20
 620        return sidx
 621
 622    def pack_config(self,s,sidx):
 623        """Packs configuration data starting at index sidx.
 624
 625        Parameters
 626        ----------
 627        s : bytes.
 628            A byte string to which configuration data will be packed.
 629        sidx : int.
 630            The starting index in the byte string `s`.
 631
 632        Returns
 633        -------
 634        int:
 635            The index of the next unused byte in the byte string `s` after packing.
 636        """
 637        for i in range(4):
 638            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_zero'][i])
 639            sidx += 4
 640        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_thresh']);sidx += 4
 641        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_LPF']);sidx += 4
 642        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['voltage_LPF']);sidx += 4
 643        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['current_LPF']);sidx += 4
 644        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['temp_LPF']);sidx += 4
 645        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_cliff']); sidx += 1
 646        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_runstop']);sidx += 1
 647        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_tilt']);sidx += 1
 648        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_low_voltage']);sidx += 1
 649        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_high_current']); sidx += 1
 650        for i in range(3):
 651            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_offsets'][i])
 652            sidx += 4
 653        for i in range(9):
 654            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_softiron_matrix'][i])
 655            sidx += 4
 656        for i in range(3):
 657            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gyro_zero_offsets'][i])
 658            sidx += 4
 659        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['rate_gyro_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
 660        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gravity_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
 661        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['accel_LPF']); sidx += 4
 662        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['bump_thresh']); sidx += 4
 663        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['low_voltage_alert']);sidx += 4
 664        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['high_current_alert']);sidx += 4
 665        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['over_tilt_alert']); sidx += 4
 666        return sidx
 667
 668    def pack_trigger(self,s,sidx):
 669        """Packs trigger data starting at index sidx.
 670
 671        Parameters
 672        ----------
 673        s : bytes.
 674            A byte string to which trigger data will be packed.
 675        sidx : int.
 676            The starting index in the byte string `s`.
 677
 678        Returns
 679        -------
 680        int:
 681            The index of the next unused byte in the byte string `s` after packing.
 682        """
 683        pack_uint32_t(s,sidx,self._trigger); sidx+=4
 684        return sidx

 730    def rpc_motor_sync_reply(self,reply):
 731        """Handle the reply to a motor sync RPC.
 732
 733        Parameters

 736            The reply received from the RPC call.
 737        """

 739            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_MOTOR_SYNC', reply[0])

 742        """Handle the reply to a configuration RPC.
 743
 744        Parameters
 745        ----------
 746        reply : list.
 747            The reply received from the RPC.
 748        """
 749        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_CONFIG:
 750            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_CONFIG', reply[0])
 751
 752    def rpc_board_info_reply(self,reply):
 753        """Handle the reply to a board information RPC.
 754
 755        Parameters
 756        ----------
 757        reply : list
 758            The reply received from the RPC.
 759        """
 760        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_BOARD_INFO:
 761            self.unpack_board_info(reply[1:])
 762        else:
 763            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_BOARD_INFO', reply[0])

 766        """Handle the reply to a trigger RPC.

 768        Parameters

 772        """
 773        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_TRIGGER:
 774            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_TRIGGER', reply[0])
 775        else:
 776            tt=unpack_uint32_t(reply[1:])

 792    # ################ Sentry #####################
 793    def get_cpu_temp(self):
 794        """Get the CPU temperature.
 795
 796        Returns
 797        -------
 798        float:
 799            The CPU temperature.
 800        """
 801        #Note, this call can be slow
 802        cpu_temp = 0
 803        try:
 804            t = psutil.sensors_temperatures()['coretemp']
 805            for c in t:
 806                cpu_temp = max(cpu_temp, c.current)
 807        except(KeyError, IOError): #May not be available on virtual machines
 808            cpu_temp=25.0
 809        return cpu_temp
 810
 811    def step_sentry(self,robot=None):
 812        """Step the sentry system for managing CPU temperature using the mobile base fan.
 813
 814        Notes
 815        -----
 816        - The function checks the CPU temperature every 10 seconds as it is slow-changing.
 817        - The fan will turn on if the CPU temperature exceeds the 'base_fan_on' threshold and has been off for at least 3 seconds.
 818        - The fan will turn off if the CPU temperature falls below the 'base_fan_off' threshold and was previously on.
 819        """
 820        if self.hw_valid and self.robot_params['robot_sentry']['base_fan_control']:
 821            #Manage CPU temp using the mobile base fan
 822            #See https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000005946/intel-nuc.html
 823
 824            if time.time()-self.ts_get_cpu_temp>10.0: #Once every 10s as is slow changing and is a slow sys call
 825                self.status['cpu_temp']=self.get_cpu_temp()
 826                self.ts_get_cpu_temp=time.time()
 827            if self.status['cpu_temp']>self.params['base_fan_on']:
 828                if self.ts_last_fan_on is None or time.time()-self.ts_last_fan_on>3.0: #Will turn itself off if don't refresh command
 829                    self.set_fan_on()
 830                    self.push_command()
 831                    self.ts_last_fan_on = time.time()
 832                if  not self.status['fan_on']:
 833                    self.logger.debug('Base fan turned on')
 834
 835            if self.fan_on_last and not self.status['fan_on']:
 836                self.logger.debug('Base fan turned off')
 837
 838            if self.status['cpu_temp']<self.params['base_fan_off']and self.status['fan_on']:
 839                self.set_fan_off()
 840                self.push_command()
 841            self.fan_on_last = self.status['fan_on']
 842
 843

 845# ######################## PIMU PROTOCOL PO #################################
 846
 847class Pimu_Protocol_P0(PimuBase):
 848    def unpack_status(self,s):
 849        """Unpacks status information and updated the `self.status` dictionary.
 850
 851        Parameters
 852        ----------
 853        s : bytes.
 854            A byte array containing packed status information.
 855
 856        Returns
 857        -------
 858        int:
 859            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
 860        """
 861        sidx=0
 862        sidx +=self.imu.unpack_status((s[sidx:]))
 863        self.status['voltage']=self.get_voltage(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 864        self.status['current'] = self.get_current(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 865        self.status['temp'] = self.get_temp(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 866
 867        for i in range(4):
 868            self.status['cliff_range'][i]=unpack_float_t(s[sidx:])
 869            sidx+=4
 870
 871        self.status['state'] = unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])
 872        sidx += 4
 873
 874        self.status['at_cliff']=[]
 875        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_0) != 0)
 876        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_1) != 0)
 877        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_2) != 0)
 878        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_3) != 0)
 879        self.status['runstop_event'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_RUNSTOP_EVENT) != 0
 880        self.status['cliff_event'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_CLIFF_EVENT) != 0
 881        self.status['fan_on'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_FAN_ON) != 0
 882        self.status['buzzer_on'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_BUZZER_ON) != 0
 883        self.status['low_voltage_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_LOW_VOLTAGE_ALERT) != 0
 884        self.status['high_current_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_HIGH_CURRENT_ALERT) != 0
 885        self.status['over_tilt_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_OVER_TILT_ALERT) != 0
 886        self.status['charger_connected'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_CHARGER_CONNECTED) != 0
 887        self.status['boot_detected'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_BOOT_DETECTED) != 0
 888        self.status['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])); sidx += 4
 889        self.status['bump_event_cnt'] = unpack_uint16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
 890        self.status['debug'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]); sidx += 4
 891        return sidx
 892
 893# ######################## PIMU PROTOCOL P1 #################################
 894class Pimu_Protocol_P1(PimuBase):
 895    def unpack_status(self, s, unpack_to=None):
 896        """Unpacks status information and updates the `unpack_to` dictionary.
 897
 898        Parameters
 899        ----------
 900        s : bytes.
 901            A byte string containing packed status data.
 902        
 903        unpack_to : dict, optional.
 904            A dictionary to store the unpacked status information, by default None.
 905
 906        Returns
 907        -------
 908        int:
 909            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
 910        """
 911        if unpack_to is None:
 912            unpack_to = self.status
 913
 914        sidx=0
 915        sidx +=self.imu.unpack_status((s[sidx:]))
 916        unpack_to['voltage']=self.get_voltage(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 917        unpack_to['current'] = self.get_current(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 918        unpack_to['temp'] = self.get_temp(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
 919
 920        for i in range(4):
 921            unpack_to['cliff_range'][i]=unpack_float_t(s[sidx:])
 922            sidx+=4
 923
 924        unpack_to['state'] = unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])
 925        sidx += 4
 926        unpack_to['at_cliff']=[]
 927        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & PimuBase.STATE_AT_CLIFF_0) != 0)
 928        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_1) != 0)
 929        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_2) != 0)
 930        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_3) != 0)
 931        unpack_to['runstop_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_RUNSTOP_EVENT) != 0
 932        unpack_to['cliff_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CLIFF_EVENT) != 0
 933        unpack_to['fan_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_FAN_ON) != 0
 934        unpack_to['buzzer_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BUZZER_ON) != 0
 935        unpack_to['low_voltage_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_LOW_VOLTAGE_ALERT) != 0
 936        unpack_to['high_current_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_HIGH_CURRENT_ALERT) != 0
 937        unpack_to['over_tilt_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_OVER_TILT_ALERT) != 0
 938        if self.board_info['hardware_id']>0:
 939            unpack_to['charger_connected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CHARGER_CONNECTED) != 0
 940            unpack_to['boot_detected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BOOT_DETECTED) != 0
 941        unpack_to['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint64_t(s[sidx:])); sidx += 8
 942        self.imu.status['timestamp'] = unpack_to['timestamp']
 943        unpack_to['bump_event_cnt'] = unpack_uint16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
 944        unpack_to['debug'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]); sidx += 4
 945        return sidx

 952# ######################## PIMU PROTOCOL P2 #################################
 953class Pimu_Protocol_P2(PimuBase):
 954
 955    def read_firmware_trace(self):
 956        """Read firmware trace data.
 957
 958        Returns
 959        -------
 960        list:
 961            A list containing the firmware trace data..
 962        """
 963        self.trace_buf = []
 964        self.timestamp.reset() #Timestamp holds state, reset within lock to avoid threading issues
 965        self.n_trace_read=1
 966        ts=time.time()
 967        while ( self.n_trace_read) and time.time()-ts<60.0:
 968            payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_READ_TRACE])
 969            self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply)
 970            time.sleep(.001)
 971        return self.trace_buf
 972
 973    def unpack_debug_trace(self,s,unpack_to):
 974        """Unpacks debug trace data into the `unpack_to` dictionary.
 975
 976        Parameters
 977        ----------
 978        s : bytes.
 979            The byte string containing debug trace information.
 980        
 981        unpack_to : dict.
 982            A dictionary to store the unpacked information.
 983
 984        Returns
 985        -------
 986        int:
 987            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
 988        """
 989        sidx=0
 990        unpack_to['u8_1']=unpack_uint8_t(s[sidx:]);sidx+=1
 991        unpack_to['u8_2'] = unpack_uint8_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 1
 992        unpack_to['f_1'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 993        unpack_to['f_2'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 994        unpack_to['f_3'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 995        return sidx
 996
 997    def unpack_print_trace(self,s,unpack_to):
 998        """Unpacks and prints trace information into the `unpack_to` dictionary.
 999
1000        Parameters
1001        ----------
1002        s : bytes.
1003            The byte string containing print trace information.
1004        
1005        unpack_to : dict.
1006            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1007
1008        Returns
1009        -------
1010        int:
1011            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1012        """
1013        sidx=0
1014        line_len=32
1015        unpack_to['timestamp']=self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint64_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 8
1016        unpack_to['line'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], line_len); sidx += line_len
1017        unpack_to['x'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
1018        return sidx
1019
1020    def rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply(self, reply):
1021        """Process the reply received after reading firmware trace data.
1022
1023        Parameters
1024        ----------
1025        reply : list.
1026            The reply received from the device.
1027        """
1028        if len(reply)>0 and reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE:
1029            self.n_trace_read=reply[1]
1030            self.trace_buf.append({'id': len(self.trace_buf), 'status': {},'debug':{},'print':{}})
1031            if reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_STATUS:
1032                self.trace_buf[-1]['status']= self.status_zero.copy()
1033                self.unpack_status(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['status'])
1034            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_DEBUG:
1035                self.unpack_debug_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['debug'])
1036            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_PRINT:
1037                self.unpack_print_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['print'])
1038            else:
1039                print('Unrecognized trace type %d'%reply[2])
1040        else:
1041            print('Error RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE')
1042            self.n_trace_read=0
1043            self.trace_buf = []
1044    def enable_firmware_trace(self):
1045        """Enable firmware trace on the device.
1046        """
1047        self._trigger = self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_ENABLE_TRACE
1048        self._dirty_trigger = True
1049
1050    def disable_firmware_trace(self):
1051        """Disable firmware trace on the device
1052        """
1053        self._trigger = self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_DISABLE_TRACE
1054        self._dirty_trigger = True
1055
1056    def unpack_status(self, s, unpack_to=None):
1057        """Unpack status information from a byte array.
1058
1059        Parameters
1060        ----------
1061        s : bytes.
1062            The byte array containing the status information.
1063        
1064        unpack_to : dict, optional
1065            A dictionary to sotre the unpacked status information, by default None
1066
1067        Returns
1068        -------
1069        int:
1070            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1071        """
1072        if unpack_to is None:
1073            unpack_to = self.status
1074
1075        sidx=0
1076        sidx +=self.imu.unpack_status((s[sidx:]))
1077        unpack_to['voltage']=self.get_voltage(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1078        unpack_to['current'] = self.get_current(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1079        unpack_to['temp'] = self.get_temp(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1080
1081        for i in range(4):
1082            unpack_to['cliff_range'][i]=unpack_float_t(s[sidx:])
1083            sidx+=4
1084
1085        unpack_to['state'] = unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])
1086        sidx += 4
1087
1088        unpack_to['at_cliff']=[]
1089        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & PimuBase.STATE_AT_CLIFF_0) != 0)
1090        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_1) != 0)
1091        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_2) != 0)
1092        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_3) != 0)
1093        unpack_to['runstop_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_RUNSTOP_EVENT) != 0
1094        unpack_to['cliff_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CLIFF_EVENT) != 0
1095        unpack_to['fan_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_FAN_ON) != 0
1096        unpack_to['buzzer_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BUZZER_ON) != 0
1097        unpack_to['low_voltage_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_LOW_VOLTAGE_ALERT) != 0
1098        unpack_to['high_current_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_HIGH_CURRENT_ALERT) != 0
1099        unpack_to['over_tilt_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_OVER_TILT_ALERT) != 0
1100        if self.board_info['hardware_id']>0:
1101            unpack_to['charger_connected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CHARGER_CONNECTED) != 0
1102            unpack_to['boot_detected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BOOT_DETECTED) != 0
1103        unpack_to['trace_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_IS_TRACE_ON) != 0
1104        unpack_to['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint64_t(s[sidx:])); sidx += 8
1105        self.imu.status['timestamp'] = unpack_to['timestamp']
1106        unpack_to['bump_event_cnt'] = unpack_uint16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
1107        unpack_to['debug'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]); sidx += 4
1108        return sidx
1109

1111class Pimu_Protocol_P3(PimuBase):
1112
1113
1114    def is_ready_for_sync(self):
1115        """
1116        With P3 this function is no longer meaningful as sync overruns are handled on the fw level
1117        """
1118        return True
1119    def trigger_motor_sync(self):
1120        """Trigger motor synchronization on the device.
1121        """
1122        # Push out immediately
1123        if not self.hw_valid:
1124            return
1125        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_SET_MOTOR_SYNC])
1126        old_sync_cnt = self.status['motor_sync_cnt']
1127        self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_motor_sync_reply)
1128
1129        t=time.time()
1130        # Should motor_sync_cnt should increment with each call to trigger_motor_sync, if not it is an overrun
1131        if self.status['motor_sync_cnt'] == old_sync_cnt:
1132            self.status['motor_sync_queues']=self.status['motor_sync_queues']+1
1133            print('Warning: Queued motor_sync as trigger_motor_sync calls above maximum rate. Overruns: %d' % (self.status['motor_sync_queues']))
1134            self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn = t
1135
1136        if self.ts_last_motor_sync is not None:
1137            self.status['motor_sync_rate']=1 / (t - self.ts_last_motor_sync)
1138        self.ts_last_motor_sync = t
1139
1140    def rpc_motor_sync_reply(self,reply):
1141        """Handle the reply to the motor synchronization command.
1142
1143        Parameters
1144        ----------
1145        reply : list.
1146            The reply received.
1147        """
1148        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_MOTOR_SYNC:
1149            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_MOTOR_SYNC', reply[0])
1150        else:
1151            self.unpack_motor_sync_reply(reply[1:])
1152
1153
1154    def unpack_motor_sync_reply(self, s):
1155        """Unpacks motor synchronization data from byte array.
1156
1157        Parameters
1158        ----------
1159        s : bytes.
1160            A byte array containing the motor synchronization data.
1161
1162        Returns
1163        -------
1164        int:
1165            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1166        """
1167        # take in an array of bytes
1168        # this needs to exactly match the C struct format
1169        sidx=0
1170        self.status['motor_sync_cnt']=  unpack_int16_t(s[sidx:])
1171        sidx += 2
1172        return sidx
1173
1174    def pull_status_aux(self):
1175        """Pull auxiliary status information.
1176        """
1177        if not self.hw_valid:
1178            return
1179        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_STATUS_AUX])
1180        self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_status_aux_reply)
1181
1182
1183    def rpc_status_aux_reply(self,reply):
1184        """Handle the reply to the auxiliary status command.
1185
1186        Parameters
1187        ----------
1188        reply : list.
1189            The reply received.
1190        """
1191        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_STATUS_AUX:
1192            self.unpack_status_aux(reply[1:])
1193        else:
1194            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_AUX_STATUS', reply[0])
1195
1196    def unpack_status_aux(self, s):
1197        """Unpacks auxiliary status data.
1198
1199        Parameters
1200        ----------
1201        s : bytes.
1202            The byte array containing the auxiliary status data.
1203
1204        Returns
1205        -------
1206        int:
1207            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1208        """
1209        # take in an array of bytes
1210        # this needs to exactly match the C struct format
1211        sidx=0
1212        self.status_aux['foo']=  unpack_int16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
1213        return sidx
1214
1215    def push_load_test(self):
1216        """Push a load test payload.
1217        """
1218        if not self.hw_valid:
1219            return
1220        payload=self.transport.get_empty_payload()
1221        payload[0] = self.RPC_LOAD_TEST_PUSH
1222        payload[1:] = self.load_test_payload
1223        self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_load_test_push_reply)
1224
1225    def pull_load_test(self):
1226        """Pull a load test payload.
1227        """
1228        if not self.hw_valid:
1229            return
1230        payload = arr.array('B',[self.RPC_LOAD_TEST_PULL])
1231        self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_load_test_pull_reply)
1232
1233
1234    def rpc_load_test_push_reply(self, reply):
1235        """Handle the reply to the load test push command.
1236
1237        Parameters
1238        ----------
1239        reply : list.
1240            The reply received.
1241        """
1242        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PUSH:
1243            print('Error RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PUSH', reply[0])
1244
1245    def rpc_load_test_pull_reply(self, reply):
1246        """Handle the reply to the load test pull command.
1247
1248        Parameters
1249        ----------
1250        reply : list.
1251            The reply received.
1252        """
1253        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PULL:
1254            d = reply[1:]
1255            for i in range(1024):
1256                if d[i] != self.load_test_payload[(i + 1) % 1024]:
1257                    print('Load test pull bad data', d[i], self.load_test_payload[(i + 1) % 1024])
1258            self.load_test_payload = d
1259            print('Successful load test pull')
1260        else:
1261            print('Error RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PULL', reply[0])
1262# ######################## PIMU #################################
1263class Pimu(PimuBase):
1264    """
1265    API to the Stretch Power and IMU board (Pimu)
1266    """
1267    def __init__(self, event_reset=False, usb=None):
1268        PimuBase.__init__(self, event_reset,usb)
1269        # Order in descending order so more recent protocols/methods override less recent
1270        self.supported_protocols = {'p0': (Pimu_Protocol_P0,), 'p1': (Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,),
1271                                    'p2': (Pimu_Protocol_P2, Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,),
1272                                    'p3': (Pimu_Protocol_P3, Pimu_Protocol_P2, Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,)}
1273
1274    def startup(self, threaded=False):
1275        """
1276        First determine which protocol version the uC firmware is running.
1277        Based on that version, replaces PimuBase class inheritance with a inheritance to a child class of PimuBase that supports that protocol
1278        """
1279        PimuBase.startup(self, threaded=threaded)
1280        if self.hw_valid:
1281            if self.board_info['protocol_version'] in self.supported_protocols:
1282                Pimu.__bases__ = self.supported_protocols[self.board_info['protocol_version']]
1283                IMU.__bases__= self.imu.supported_protocols[self.board_info['protocol_version']]
1284            else:
1285                if self.board_info['protocol_version'] is None:
1286                    protocol_msg = """
1287                                    ----------------
1288                                    Failure in communications for {0} on startup.
1289                                    Please power cycle the robot and try again.
1290                                    ----------------
1291                                    """.format(self.name)
1292                else:
1293                    protocol_msg = """
1294                    ----------------
1295                    Firmware protocol mismatch on {0}.
1296                    Protocol on board is {1}.
1297                    Valid protocols are: {2}.
1298                    Disabling device.
1299                    Please upgrade the firmware and/or version of Stretch Body.
1300                    ----------------
1301                    """.format(self.name, self.board_info['protocol_version'], self.supported_protocols.keys())
1302                self.logger.warning(textwrap.dedent(protocol_msg))
1303                self.hw_valid = False
1304                self.transport.stop()
1305        if self.hw_valid:
1306            self.push_command()
1307            self.pull_status()
1308        return self.hw_valid

19class IMUBase(Device):
20    """
21    API to the Stretch IMU found in the base
22    """
23    def __init__(self):
24        Device.__init__(self, 'imu',req_params=False)
25        #pitch; //-180 to 180, rolls over
26        #roll; //-90 to  90, rolls over at 180
27        #heading; //0-360.0, rolls over
28        self.status={'ax':0,'ay':0,'az':0,'gx':0,'gy':0,'gz':0,'mx':0,'my':0,'mz':0,'roll':0,'pitch':0,'heading':0,'timestamp':0,'qw':0,'qx':0,'qy':0,'qz':0,'bump':0}
29
30    def get_status(self):
31        """Returns a copy of the internal status.
32
33        Returns
34        -------
35        dict:
36            A copy of the internal status dictionary containing IMU status.
37        """
38        s=self.status.copy()
39        return s
40
41    def get_quaternion(self):
42        """Returns the quaternion values representing the IMU's orientation.
43
44        Returns
45        -------
46        list:
47            A list containing the quaternion values.
48        """
49        return [self.status['qw'],self.status['qx'],self.status['qy'],self.status['qz']]

56        print('AX (m/s^2)', self.status['ax'])

58        print('AZ (m/s^2)', self.status['az'])
59        print('GX (rad/s)', self.status['gx'])
60        print('GY (rad/s)', self.status['gy'])
61        print('GZ (rad/s)', self.status['gz'])
62        print('MX (uTesla)', self.status['mx'])
63        print('MY (uTesla)', self.status['my'])
64        print('MZ (uTesla)', self.status['mz'])
65        print('QW', self.status['qw'])
66        print('QX', self.status['qx'])
67        print('QY', self.status['qy'])
68        print('QZ', self.status['qz'])
69        print('Roll (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['roll']))
70        print('Pitch (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['pitch']))
71        print('Heading (deg)', rad_to_deg(self.status['heading']))
72        print('Bump', self.status['bump'])
73        print('Timestamp (s)', self.status['timestamp'])
74        print('-----------------------')
75
76    def unpack_status(self, s):
77        """@private"""
78        raise NotImplementedError('This method not supported by IMU for firmware.')

152        self.status['bump'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
153        return sidx

Unpacks status information and updated the self.status dictionary.

Parameters

s : bytes. A byte array containing packed status information.

Returns

int: The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.

282                       'timestamp': 0,'at_cliff':[False,False,False,False], 'runstop_event': False, 'bump_event_cnt': 0,
283                       'cliff_event': False, 'fan_on': False, 'buzzer_on': False, 'low_voltage_alert':False,'high_current_alert':False,'over_tilt_alert':False,
284                       'charger_connected':False, 'boot_detected':False,'imu': self.imu.status,'debug':0,'state':0,'trace_on':0,
285                       'motor_sync_rate': 0, 'motor_sync_cnt': 0, 'motor_sync_queues': 0, 'motor_sync_drop': 0,
286                       'transport': self.transport.status}

297            self.cliff_event_reset()

307    # ###########  Device Methods #############
308
309    def startup(self, threaded=False):
310        try:
311            Device.startup(self, threaded=threaded)
312            self.hw_valid = self.transport.startup()
313            if self.hw_valid:
314                payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_BOARD_INFO])
315                self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_board_info_reply)
316                self.transport.configure_version(self.board_info['firmware_version'])
317                return True
318            return False
319        except KeyError:
320            self.hw_valid =False
321            return False
322
323
324    def stop(self):
325        Device.stop(self)
326        if not self.hw_valid:
327            return
328        self.set_fan_off()
329        self.push_command(exiting=True)
330        self.transport.stop()
331        self.hw_valid = False
332
333    def set_config(self,c):
334        """Set the configuration.
335
336        Parameters
337        ----------
338        c : dict.
339            A dictionary containing the configuration settings.
340        """
341        self.config=c.copy()
342        self._dirty_config = True
343
344    def pull_status(self, exiting=False):
345        """Pull the status information from the hardware synchronously
346        """
347        if not self.hw_valid:
348            return
349        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_STATUS])
350        self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_status_reply)
351
352    async def pull_status_async(self, exiting=False):
353        """Pull the status information from the hardware asynchronosly
354        """
355        if not self.hw_valid:
356            return
357        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_STATUS])
358        await self.transport.do_pull_rpc_async(payload, self.rpc_status_reply, exiting=exiting)
359
360    async def push_command_async(self, exiting=False):
361        """Push a command to the hardware asynchronously
362        """
363        if not self.hw_valid:
364            return
365        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
366        if self._dirty_config:
367            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
368            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
369            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
370            self._dirty_config = False
371
372        if self._dirty_trigger:
373            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
374            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
375            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
376            self._trigger = 0
377            self._dirty_trigger = False
378
379    def push_command(self, exiting=False):
380        """Push a command to the hardware synchronously
381        """
382        if not self.hw_valid:
383            return
384        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
385        if self._dirty_config:
386            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
387            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
388            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
389            self._dirty_config = False
390
391        if self._dirty_trigger:
392            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
393            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
394            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
395            self._trigger = 0
396            self._dirty_trigger = False
397
398    def pretty_print(self):
399        """Pretty print the status information of the Pimu.
400        """
401        print('------ Pimu -----')
402        print('Voltage',self.status['voltage'])
403        print('Current', self.status['current'])
404        print('CPU Temp',self.status['cpu_temp'])
405        print('Board Temp', self.status['temp'])
406        print('State', self.status['state'])
407        print('At Cliff', self.status['at_cliff'])
408        print('Cliff Range', self.status['cliff_range'])
409        print('Cliff Event', self.status['cliff_event'])
410        print('Runstop Event', self.status['runstop_event'])
411        print('Bump Event Cnt', self.status['bump_event_cnt'])
412        print('Fan On', self.status['fan_on'])
413        print('Buzzer On', self.status['buzzer_on'])
414        print('Low Voltage Alert', self.status['low_voltage_alert'])
415        print('High Current Alert', self.status['high_current_alert'])
416        print('Over Tilt Alert',self.status['over_tilt_alert'])
417        print('Trace on:', self.status['trace_on'])
418        if self.board_info['hardware_id']>0:
419            print('Charger Connected', self.status['charger_connected'])
420            print('Boot Detected', self.status['boot_detected'])
421        print('Debug', self.status['debug'])
422        print('Timestamp (s)', self.status['timestamp'])
423        #print('Read error', self.transport.status['read_error'])
424        print('Queued motor sync', self.status['motor_sync_queues'])
425        print('Motor sync rate', self.status['motor_sync_rate'])
426        print('Motor sync cnt', self.status['motor_sync_cnt'])
427        print('Board variant:',self.board_info['board_variant'])
428        print('Firmware version:', self.board_info['firmware_version'])
429        print('Transport version:', self.transport.version)
430        self.imu.pretty_print()

470    def is_ready_for_sync(self):
471        """Check if the robot is ready for motor synchronization.
472
473        Returns
474        -------
475        bool:
476            True if it's ready for synchronization, False otberwise.
477        """
478        # For RE1.0 robots (hardware_id==0) the runstop and sync line are shared
479        # This limits the maximum rate that the motor sync can be triggered
480        # For RE2.0 robots the sync rate is limited by the min pulse width (~10ms)
481        #Track the rate that the sync is triggered
482        # This is called once prior to issuing stepper push_commands
483        # If it is True then trigger_motor_sync is safe to call after the push_commands
484        # By calling it first, it ensures that the sync rate is accurate (eg, not measuring timing of RPC, etc)
485        t = time.time()
486        if self.ts_last_motor_sync is not None:
487            rate=1 / (t - self.ts_last_motor_sync)
488            if rate>self.params['max_sync_rate_hz']:
489                self.status['motor_sync_drop'] += 1
490                if self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn is None or t-self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn>5.0:
491                    print('Warning: Rate of calls to Pimu:trigger_motor_sync rate of %f above maximum frequency of %.2f Hz. Motor commands dropped: %d'%(rate,self.params['max_sync_rate_hz'],self.status['motor_sync_drop']))
492                    self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn=t
493                return False
494            self.status['motor_sync_rate'] = rate #Only update rate if it is ready
495        return True
496
497    def trigger_motor_sync(self):
498        """Trigger motor synchronization.
499        """
500        #Push out immediately
501        if not self.hw_valid:
502            return
503        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_SET_MOTOR_SYNC])
504        self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_motor_sync_reply)
505        self.ts_last_motor_sync = time.time()
506

544    # ########### Sensor Calibration #################
545    def get_voltage(self,raw):
546        """Convert raw ADC value to voltage.
547
548        Parameters
549        ----------
550        raw : int.
551            The raw value.
552
553        Returns
554        -------
555        float:
556            The voltage in volts.
557        """
558        raw_to_V = 20.0/1024 #10bit adc, 0-20V per 0-3.3V reading
559        return raw*raw_to_V
560
561
562    def get_temp(self,raw):
563        """Convert raw value to temperature in degrees Celsius
564
565        Parameters
566        ----------
567        raw : int.
568            The raw value.
569
570        Returns
571        -------
572        float:
573            The temperature in degrees Celsius.
574        """
575        raw_to_mV = 3300/1024.0
576        mV = raw*raw_to_mV - 400 #400mV at 0C per spec
577        C = mV/19.5 #19.5mV per C per spec
578        return C
579
580    def get_current(self,raw):
581        """Convert raw value to current in amperes.
582
583        Parameters
584        ----------
585        raw : int.
586            The raw value.
587
588        Returns
589        -------
590        float:
591            The current in amperes.
592        """
593        raw_to_mV = 3300 / 1024.0
594        mV = raw * raw_to_mV
595        mA = mV/.408 # conversion per circuit
596        return mA/1000.0
597    # ################Data Packing #####################
598
599    def unpack_board_info(self,s):
600        """Unpack board information from a byte array.
601
602        Parameters
603        ----------
604        s : bytes.
605            The byte array containing board information.
606
607        Returns
608        -------
609        int:
610            The index #### NEED TO CHECK #####
611        """
612        sidx=0
613        self.board_info['board_variant'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
614        self.board_info['hardware_id'] = 0
615        if len(self.board_info['board_variant'])==6: #New format of Pimu.x Older format of Pimu.BoardName.Vx' If older format,default to 0
616            self.board_info['hardware_id']=int(self.board_info['board_variant'][-1])
617        sidx += 20
618        self.board_info['firmware_version'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
619        self.board_info['protocol_version'] = self.board_info['firmware_version'][self.board_info['firmware_version'].rfind('p'):]
620        sidx += 20
621        return sidx
622
623    def pack_config(self,s,sidx):
624        """Packs configuration data starting at index sidx.
625
626        Parameters
627        ----------
628        s : bytes.
629            A byte string to which configuration data will be packed.
630        sidx : int.
631            The starting index in the byte string `s`.
632
633        Returns
634        -------
635        int:
636            The index of the next unused byte in the byte string `s` after packing.
637        """
638        for i in range(4):
639            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_zero'][i])
640            sidx += 4
641        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_thresh']);sidx += 4
642        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_LPF']);sidx += 4
643        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['voltage_LPF']);sidx += 4
644        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['current_LPF']);sidx += 4
645        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['temp_LPF']);sidx += 4
646        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_cliff']); sidx += 1
647        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_runstop']);sidx += 1
648        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_tilt']);sidx += 1
649        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_low_voltage']);sidx += 1
650        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_high_current']); sidx += 1
651        for i in range(3):
652            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_offsets'][i])
653            sidx += 4
654        for i in range(9):
655            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_softiron_matrix'][i])
656            sidx += 4
657        for i in range(3):
658            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gyro_zero_offsets'][i])
659            sidx += 4
660        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['rate_gyro_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
661        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gravity_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
662        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['accel_LPF']); sidx += 4
663        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['bump_thresh']); sidx += 4
664        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['low_voltage_alert']);sidx += 4
665        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['high_current_alert']);sidx += 4
666        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['over_tilt_alert']); sidx += 4
667        return sidx
668
669    def pack_trigger(self,s,sidx):
670        """Packs trigger data starting at index sidx.
671
672        Parameters
673        ----------
674        s : bytes.
675            A byte string to which trigger data will be packed.
676        sidx : int.
677            The starting index in the byte string `s`.
678
679        Returns
680        -------
681        int:
682            The index of the next unused byte in the byte string `s` after packing.
683        """
684        pack_uint32_t(s,sidx,self._trigger); sidx+=4
685        return sidx

731    def rpc_motor_sync_reply(self,reply):
732        """Handle the reply to a motor sync RPC.
733
734        Parameters
735        ----------
736        reply : list.
737            The reply received from the RPC call.
738        """
739        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_MOTOR_SYNC:
740            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_MOTOR_SYNC', reply[0])
741
742    def rpc_config_reply(self,reply):
743        """Handle the reply to a configuration RPC.
744
745        Parameters
746        ----------
747        reply : list.
748            The reply received from the RPC.
749        """
750        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_CONFIG:
751            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_CONFIG', reply[0])
752
753    def rpc_board_info_reply(self,reply):
754        """Handle the reply to a board information RPC.
755
756        Parameters
757        ----------
758        reply : list
759            The reply received from the RPC.
760        """
761        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_BOARD_INFO:
762            self.unpack_board_info(reply[1:])
763        else:
764            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_BOARD_INFO', reply[0])
765
766    def rpc_trigger_reply(self,reply):
767        """Handle the reply to a trigger RPC.
768
769        Parameters
770        ----------
771        reply : list.
772            The reply received from the RPC.
773        """
774        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_TRIGGER:
775            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_TRIGGER', reply[0])
776        else:
777            tt=unpack_uint32_t(reply[1:])
778
779    def rpc_status_reply(self,reply):
780        """Handle the reply to a status RPC.
781
782        Parameters
783        ----------
784        reply : list.
785            The reply received from the RPC.
786        """
787        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_PIMU_STATUS:
788            self.unpack_status(reply[1:])
789        else:
790            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_STATUS', reply[0])
791
792
793    # ################ Sentry #####################
794    def get_cpu_temp(self):
795        """Get the CPU temperature.
796
797        Returns
798        -------
799        float:
800            The CPU temperature.
801        """
802        #Note, this call can be slow
803        cpu_temp = 0
804        try:
805            t = psutil.sensors_temperatures()['coretemp']
806            for c in t:
807                cpu_temp = max(cpu_temp, c.current)
808        except(KeyError, IOError): #May not be available on virtual machines
809            cpu_temp=25.0
810        return cpu_temp
811
812    def step_sentry(self,robot=None):
813        """Step the sentry system for managing CPU temperature using the mobile base fan.
814
815        Notes
816        -----
817        - The function checks the CPU temperature every 10 seconds as it is slow-changing.
818        - The fan will turn on if the CPU temperature exceeds the 'base_fan_on' threshold and has been off for at least 3 seconds.
819        - The fan will turn off if the CPU temperature falls below the 'base_fan_off' threshold and was previously on.
820        """
821        if self.hw_valid and self.robot_params['robot_sentry']['base_fan_control']:
822            #Manage CPU temp using the mobile base fan
823            #See https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000005946/intel-nuc.html
824
825            if time.time()-self.ts_get_cpu_temp>10.0: #Once every 10s as is slow changing and is a slow sys call
826                self.status['cpu_temp']=self.get_cpu_temp()
827                self.ts_get_cpu_temp=time.time()
828            if self.status['cpu_temp']>self.params['base_fan_on']:
829                if self.ts_last_fan_on is None or time.time()-self.ts_last_fan_on>3.0: #Will turn itself off if don't refresh command
830                    self.set_fan_on()
831                    self.push_command()
832                    self.ts_last_fan_on = time.time()
833                if  not self.status['fan_on']:
834                    self.logger.debug('Base fan turned on')
835
836            if self.fan_on_last and not self.status['fan_on']:
837                self.logger.debug('Base fan turned off')
838
839            if self.status['cpu_temp']<self.params['base_fan_off']and self.status['fan_on']:
840                self.set_fan_off()
841                self.push_command()
842            self.fan_on_last = self.status['fan_on']

API to the Stretch Power and IMU board (Pimu)

def startup(self, threaded=False): 
309    def startup(self, threaded=False):
310        try:
311            Device.startup(self, threaded=threaded)
312            self.hw_valid = self.transport.startup()
313            if self.hw_valid:
314                payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_GET_PIMU_BOARD_INFO])
315                self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_board_info_reply)
316                self.transport.configure_version(self.board_info['firmware_version'])
317                return True
318            return False
319        except KeyError:
320            self.hw_valid =False
321            return False

async def push_command_async(self, exiting=False): 
360    async def push_command_async(self, exiting=False):
361        """Push a command to the hardware asynchronously
362        """
363        if not self.hw_valid:
364            return
365        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
366        if self._dirty_config:
367            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
368            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
369            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
370            self._dirty_config = False
371
372        if self._dirty_trigger:
373            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
374            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
375            await self.transport.do_push_rpc_async(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
376            self._trigger = 0
377            self._dirty_trigger = False

Push a command to the hardware asynchronously

def push_command(self, exiting=False): 
379    def push_command(self, exiting=False):
380        """Push a command to the hardware synchronously
381        """
382        if not self.hw_valid:
383            return
384        payload = self.transport.get_empty_payload()
385        if self._dirty_config:
386            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_CONFIG
387            sidx = self.pack_config(payload, 1)
388            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_config_reply)
389            self._dirty_config = False
390
391        if self._dirty_trigger:
392            payload[0] = self.RPC_SET_PIMU_TRIGGER
393            sidx = self.pack_trigger(payload, 1)
394            self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload[:sidx], self.rpc_trigger_reply)
395            self._trigger = 0
396            self._dirty_trigger = False

def is_ready_for_sync(self): 
470    def is_ready_for_sync(self):
471        """Check if the robot is ready for motor synchronization.
472
473        Returns
474        -------
475        bool:
476            True if it's ready for synchronization, False otberwise.
477        """
478        # For RE1.0 robots (hardware_id==0) the runstop and sync line are shared
479        # This limits the maximum rate that the motor sync can be triggered
480        # For RE2.0 robots the sync rate is limited by the min pulse width (~10ms)
481        #Track the rate that the sync is triggered
482        # This is called once prior to issuing stepper push_commands
483        # If it is True then trigger_motor_sync is safe to call after the push_commands
484        # By calling it first, it ensures that the sync rate is accurate (eg, not measuring timing of RPC, etc)
485        t = time.time()
486        if self.ts_last_motor_sync is not None:
487            rate=1 / (t - self.ts_last_motor_sync)
488            if rate>self.params['max_sync_rate_hz']:
489                self.status['motor_sync_drop'] += 1
490                if self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn is None or t-self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn>5.0:
491                    print('Warning: Rate of calls to Pimu:trigger_motor_sync rate of %f above maximum frequency of %.2f Hz. Motor commands dropped: %d'%(rate,self.params['max_sync_rate_hz'],self.status['motor_sync_drop']))
492                    self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn=t
493                return False
494            self.status['motor_sync_rate'] = rate #Only update rate if it is ready
495        return True

Check if the robot is ready for motor synchronization.

Returns

bool: True if it's ready for synchronization, False otberwise.

def get_temp(self, raw): 
562    def get_temp(self,raw):
563        """Convert raw value to temperature in degrees Celsius
564
565        Parameters
566        ----------

569
570        Returns
571        -------

573            The temperature in degrees Celsius.

def unpack_board_info(self, s): 
599    def unpack_board_info(self,s):
600        """Unpack board information from a byte array.
601
602        Parameters
603        ----------
604        s : bytes.
605            The byte array containing board information.
606
607        Returns
608        -------
609        int:
610            The index #### NEED TO CHECK #####
611        """
612        sidx=0
613        self.board_info['board_variant'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
614        self.board_info['hardware_id'] = 0
615        if len(self.board_info['board_variant'])==6: #New format of Pimu.x Older format of Pimu.BoardName.Vx' If older format,default to 0
616            self.board_info['hardware_id']=int(self.board_info['board_variant'][-1])
617        sidx += 20
618        self.board_info['firmware_version'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], 20)
619        self.board_info['protocol_version'] = self.board_info['firmware_version'][self.board_info['firmware_version'].rfind('p'):]
620        sidx += 20
621        return sidx

def pack_config(self, s, sidx): 
623    def pack_config(self,s,sidx):
624        """Packs configuration data starting at index sidx.
625
626        Parameters
627        ----------
628        s : bytes.
629            A byte string to which configuration data will be packed.
630        sidx : int.
631            The starting index in the byte string `s`.
632
633        Returns
634        -------
635        int:
636            The index of the next unused byte in the byte string `s` after packing.
637        """
638        for i in range(4):
639            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_zero'][i])
640            sidx += 4
641        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_thresh']);sidx += 4
642        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['cliff_LPF']);sidx += 4
643        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['voltage_LPF']);sidx += 4
644        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['current_LPF']);sidx += 4
645        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['temp_LPF']);sidx += 4
646        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_cliff']); sidx += 1
647        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_runstop']);sidx += 1
648        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_tilt']);sidx += 1
649        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_low_voltage']);sidx += 1
650        pack_uint8_t(s, sidx, self.config['stop_at_high_current']); sidx += 1
651        for i in range(3):
652            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_offsets'][i])
653            sidx += 4
654        for i in range(9):
655            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['mag_softiron_matrix'][i])
656            sidx += 4
657        for i in range(3):
658            pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gyro_zero_offsets'][i])
659            sidx += 4
660        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['rate_gyro_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
661        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['gravity_vector_scale']); sidx += 4
662        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['accel_LPF']); sidx += 4
663        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['bump_thresh']); sidx += 4
664        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['low_voltage_alert']);sidx += 4
665        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['high_current_alert']);sidx += 4
666        pack_float_t(s, sidx, self.config['over_tilt_alert']); sidx += 4
667        return sidx

764            self.logger.warning('Error RPC_REPLY_PIMU_BOARD_INFO', reply[0])
