def get_cpu_temp(self): 
794    def get_cpu_temp(self):
795        """Get the CPU temperature.
796
797        Returns
798        -------
799        float:
800            The CPU temperature.
801        """
802        #Note, this call can be slow
803        cpu_temp = 0
804        try:
805            t = psutil.sensors_temperatures()['coretemp']
806            for c in t:
807                cpu_temp = max(cpu_temp, c.current)
808        except(KeyError, IOError): #May not be available on virtual machines
809            cpu_temp=25.0
810        return cpu_temp

Get the CPU temperature.

Returns

float: The CPU temperature.

def step_sentry(self, robot=None): 
812    def step_sentry(self,robot=None):
813        """Step the sentry system for managing CPU temperature using the mobile base fan.
814
815        Notes
816        -----
817        - The function checks the CPU temperature every 10 seconds as it is slow-changing.
818        - The fan will turn on if the CPU temperature exceeds the 'base_fan_on' threshold and has been off for at least 3 seconds.
819        - The fan will turn off if the CPU temperature falls below the 'base_fan_off' threshold and was previously on.
820        """
821        if self.hw_valid and self.robot_params['robot_sentry']['base_fan_control']:
822            #Manage CPU temp using the mobile base fan
823            #See https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000005946/intel-nuc.html
824
825            if time.time()-self.ts_get_cpu_temp>10.0: #Once every 10s as is slow changing and is a slow sys call
826                self.status['cpu_temp']=self.get_cpu_temp()
827                self.ts_get_cpu_temp=time.time()
828            if self.status['cpu_temp']>self.params['base_fan_on']:
829                if self.ts_last_fan_on is None or time.time()-self.ts_last_fan_on>3.0: #Will turn itself off if don't refresh command
830                    self.set_fan_on()
831                    self.push_command()
832                    self.ts_last_fan_on = time.time()
833                if  not self.status['fan_on']:
834                    self.logger.debug('Base fan turned on')
835
836            if self.fan_on_last and not self.status['fan_on']:
837                self.logger.debug('Base fan turned off')
838
839            if self.status['cpu_temp']<self.params['base_fan_off']and self.status['fan_on']:
840                self.set_fan_off()
841                self.push_command()
842            self.fan_on_last = self.status['fan_on']

Step the sentry system for managing CPU temperature using the mobile base fan.

Notes

  • The function checks the CPU temperature every 10 seconds as it is slow-changing.
  • The fan will turn on if the CPU temperature exceeds the 'base_fan_on' threshold and has been off for at least 3 seconds.
  • The fan will turn off if the CPU temperature falls below the 'base_fan_off' threshold and was previously on.

849    def unpack_status(self,s):
850        """Unpacks status information and updated the `self.status` dictionary.
851
852        Parameters
853        ----------
854        s : bytes.
855            A byte array containing packed status information.
856
857        Returns
858        -------
859        int:
860            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
861        """
862        sidx=0
863        sidx +=self.imu.unpack_status((s[sidx:]))
864        self.status['voltage']=self.get_voltage(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
865        self.status['current'] = self.get_current(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
866        self.status['temp'] = self.get_temp(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
867
868        for i in range(4):
869            self.status['cliff_range'][i]=unpack_float_t(s[sidx:])
870            sidx+=4
871
872        self.status['state'] = unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])
873        sidx += 4
874
875        self.status['at_cliff']=[]
876        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_0) != 0)
877        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_1) != 0)
878        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_2) != 0)
879        self.status['at_cliff'].append((self.status['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_3) != 0)
880        self.status['runstop_event'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_RUNSTOP_EVENT) != 0
881        self.status['cliff_event'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_CLIFF_EVENT) != 0
882        self.status['fan_on'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_FAN_ON) != 0
883        self.status['buzzer_on'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_BUZZER_ON) != 0
884        self.status['low_voltage_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_LOW_VOLTAGE_ALERT) != 0
885        self.status['high_current_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_HIGH_CURRENT_ALERT) != 0
886        self.status['over_tilt_alert'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_OVER_TILT_ALERT) != 0
887        self.status['charger_connected'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_CHARGER_CONNECTED) != 0
888        self.status['boot_detected'] = (self.status['state'] & self.STATE_BOOT_DETECTED) != 0
889        self.status['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])); sidx += 4
890        self.status['bump_event_cnt'] = unpack_uint16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
891        self.status['debug'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]); sidx += 4
892        return sidx

class Pimu_Protocol_P2(PimuBase): 
 954class Pimu_Protocol_P2(PimuBase):
 955
 956    def read_firmware_trace(self):
 957        """Read firmware trace data.
 958
 959        Returns
 960        -------
 961        list:
 962            A list containing the firmware trace data..
 963        """
 964        self.trace_buf = []
 965        self.timestamp.reset() #Timestamp holds state, reset within lock to avoid threading issues
 966        self.n_trace_read=1
 967        ts=time.time()
 968        while ( self.n_trace_read) and time.time()-ts<60.0:
 969            payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_READ_TRACE])
 970            self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply)
 971            time.sleep(.001)
 972        return self.trace_buf
 973
 974    def unpack_debug_trace(self,s,unpack_to):
 975        """Unpacks debug trace data into the `unpack_to` dictionary.
 976
 977        Parameters
 978        ----------
 979        s : bytes.
 980            The byte string containing debug trace information.
 981        
 982        unpack_to : dict.
 983            A dictionary to store the unpacked information.
 984
 985        Returns
 986        -------
 987        int:
 988            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
 989        """
 990        sidx=0
 991        unpack_to['u8_1']=unpack_uint8_t(s[sidx:]);sidx+=1
 992        unpack_to['u8_2'] = unpack_uint8_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 1
 993        unpack_to['f_1'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 994        unpack_to['f_2'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 995        unpack_to['f_3'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
 996        return sidx
 997
 998    def unpack_print_trace(self,s,unpack_to):
 999        """Unpacks and prints trace information into the `unpack_to` dictionary.
1000
1001        Parameters
1002        ----------
1003        s : bytes.
1004            The byte string containing print trace information.
1005        
1006        unpack_to : dict.
1007            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1008
1009        Returns
1010        -------
1011        int:
1012            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1013        """
1014        sidx=0
1015        line_len=32
1016        unpack_to['timestamp']=self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint64_t(s[sidx:]));sidx += 8
1017        unpack_to['line'] = unpack_string_t(s[sidx:], line_len); sidx += line_len
1018        unpack_to['x'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 4
1019        return sidx
1020
1021    def rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply(self, reply):
1022        """Process the reply received after reading firmware trace data.
1023
1024        Parameters
1025        ----------
1026        reply : list.
1027            The reply received from the device.
1028        """
1029        if len(reply)>0 and reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE:
1030            self.n_trace_read=reply[1]
1031            self.trace_buf.append({'id': len(self.trace_buf), 'status': {},'debug':{},'print':{}})
1032            if reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_STATUS:
1033                self.trace_buf[-1]['status']= self.status_zero.copy()
1034                self.unpack_status(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['status'])
1035            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_DEBUG:
1036                self.unpack_debug_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['debug'])
1037            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_PRINT:
1038                self.unpack_print_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['print'])
1039            else:
1040                print('Unrecognized trace type %d'%reply[2])
1041        else:
1042            print('Error RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE')
1043            self.n_trace_read=0
1044            self.trace_buf = []
1045    def enable_firmware_trace(self):
1046        """Enable firmware trace on the device.
1047        """
1048        self._trigger = self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_ENABLE_TRACE
1049        self._dirty_trigger = True
1050
1051    def disable_firmware_trace(self):
1052        """Disable firmware trace on the device
1053        """
1054        self._trigger = self._trigger | self.TRIGGER_DISABLE_TRACE
1055        self._dirty_trigger = True
1056
1057    def unpack_status(self, s, unpack_to=None):
1058        """Unpack status information from a byte array.
1059
1060        Parameters
1061        ----------
1062        s : bytes.
1063            The byte array containing the status information.
1064        
1065        unpack_to : dict, optional
1066            A dictionary to sotre the unpacked status information, by default None
1067
1068        Returns
1069        -------
1070        int:
1071            The index indicating the position in the byte array after unpacking.
1072        """
1073        if unpack_to is None:
1074            unpack_to = self.status
1075
1076        sidx=0
1077        sidx +=self.imu.unpack_status((s[sidx:]))
1078        unpack_to['voltage']=self.get_voltage(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1079        unpack_to['current'] = self.get_current(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1080        unpack_to['temp'] = self.get_temp(unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]));sidx+=4
1081
1082        for i in range(4):
1083            unpack_to['cliff_range'][i]=unpack_float_t(s[sidx:])
1084            sidx+=4
1085
1086        unpack_to['state'] = unpack_uint32_t(s[sidx:])
1087        sidx += 4
1088
1089        unpack_to['at_cliff']=[]
1090        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & PimuBase.STATE_AT_CLIFF_0) != 0)
1091        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_1) != 0)
1092        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_2) != 0)
1093        unpack_to['at_cliff'].append((unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_AT_CLIFF_3) != 0)
1094        unpack_to['runstop_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_RUNSTOP_EVENT) != 0
1095        unpack_to['cliff_event'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CLIFF_EVENT) != 0
1096        unpack_to['fan_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_FAN_ON) != 0
1097        unpack_to['buzzer_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BUZZER_ON) != 0
1098        unpack_to['low_voltage_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_LOW_VOLTAGE_ALERT) != 0
1099        unpack_to['high_current_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_HIGH_CURRENT_ALERT) != 0
1100        unpack_to['over_tilt_alert'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_OVER_TILT_ALERT) != 0
1101        if self.board_info['hardware_id']>0:
1102            unpack_to['charger_connected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_CHARGER_CONNECTED) != 0
1103            unpack_to['boot_detected'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_BOOT_DETECTED) != 0
1104        unpack_to['trace_on'] = (unpack_to['state'] & self.STATE_IS_TRACE_ON) != 0
1105        unpack_to['timestamp'] = self.timestamp.set(unpack_uint64_t(s[sidx:])); sidx += 8
1106        self.imu.status['timestamp'] = unpack_to['timestamp']
1107        unpack_to['bump_event_cnt'] = unpack_uint16_t(s[sidx:]);sidx += 2
1108        unpack_to['debug'] = unpack_float_t(s[sidx:]); sidx += 4
1109        return sidx

def read_firmware_trace(self): 
956    def read_firmware_trace(self):
957        """Read firmware trace data.
958
959        Returns
960        -------
961        list:
962            A list containing the firmware trace data..
963        """
964        self.trace_buf = []
965        self.timestamp.reset() #Timestamp holds state, reset within lock to avoid threading issues
966        self.n_trace_read=1
967        ts=time.time()
968        while ( self.n_trace_read) and time.time()-ts<60.0:
969            payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_READ_TRACE])
970            self.transport.do_pull_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply)
971            time.sleep(.001)
972        return self.trace_buf

def rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply(self, reply): 
1021    def rpc_read_firmware_trace_reply(self, reply):
1022        """Process the reply received after reading firmware trace data.
1023
1024        Parameters
1025        ----------
1026        reply : list.
1027            The reply received from the device.
1028        """
1029        if len(reply)>0 and reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE:
1030            self.n_trace_read=reply[1]
1031            self.trace_buf.append({'id': len(self.trace_buf), 'status': {},'debug':{},'print':{}})
1032            if reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_STATUS:
1033                self.trace_buf[-1]['status']= self.status_zero.copy()
1034                self.unpack_status(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['status'])
1035            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_DEBUG:
1036                self.unpack_debug_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['debug'])
1037            elif reply[2]==self.TRACE_TYPE_PRINT:
1038                self.unpack_print_trace(reply[3:],unpack_to=self.trace_buf[-1]['print'])
1039            else:
1040                print('Unrecognized trace type %d'%reply[2])
1041        else:
1042            print('Error RPC_REPLY_READ_TRACE')
1043            self.n_trace_read=0
1044            self.trace_buf = []

Process the reply received after reading firmware trace data.

Parameters

reply : list. The reply received from the device.

1120    def trigger_motor_sync(self):
1121        """Trigger motor synchronization on the device.
1122        """
1123        # Push out immediately
1124        if not self.hw_valid:
1125            return
1126        payload = arr.array('B', [self.RPC_SET_MOTOR_SYNC])
1127        old_sync_cnt = self.status['motor_sync_cnt']
1128        self.transport.do_push_rpc_sync(payload, self.rpc_motor_sync_reply)
1129
1130        t=time.time()
1131        # Should motor_sync_cnt should increment with each call to trigger_motor_sync, if not it is an overrun
1132        if self.status['motor_sync_cnt'] == old_sync_cnt:
1133            self.status['motor_sync_queues']=self.status['motor_sync_queues']+1
1134            print('Warning: Queued motor_sync as trigger_motor_sync calls above maximum rate. Overruns: %d' % (self.status['motor_sync_queues']))
1135            self.ts_last_motor_sync_warn = t
1136
1137        if self.ts_last_motor_sync is not None:
1138            self.status['motor_sync_rate']=1 / (t - self.ts_last_motor_sync)
1139        self.ts_last_motor_sync = t

1243        if reply[0] != self.RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PUSH:
1244            print('Error RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PUSH', reply[0])

def rpc_load_test_pull_reply(self, reply): 
1246    def rpc_load_test_pull_reply(self, reply):
1247        """Handle the reply to the load test pull command.
1248
1249        Parameters
1250        ----------
1251        reply : list.
1252            The reply received.
1253        """
1254        if reply[0] == self.RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PULL:
1255            d = reply[1:]
1256            for i in range(1024):
1257                if d[i] != self.load_test_payload[(i + 1) % 1024]:
1258                    print('Load test pull bad data', d[i], self.load_test_payload[(i + 1) % 1024])
1259            self.load_test_payload = d
1260            print('Successful load test pull')
1261        else:
1262            print('Error RPC_REPLY_LOAD_TEST_PULL', reply[0])

class Pimu(PimuBase): 
1264class Pimu(PimuBase):
1265    """
1266    API to the Stretch Power and IMU board (Pimu)
1267    """
1268    def __init__(self, event_reset=False, usb=None):
1269        PimuBase.__init__(self, event_reset,usb)
1270        # Order in descending order so more recent protocols/methods override less recent
1271        self.supported_protocols = {'p0': (Pimu_Protocol_P0,), 'p1': (Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,),
1272                                    'p2': (Pimu_Protocol_P2, Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,),
1273                                    'p3': (Pimu_Protocol_P3, Pimu_Protocol_P2, Pimu_Protocol_P1, Pimu_Protocol_P0,)}
1274
1275    def startup(self, threaded=False):
1276        """
1277        First determine which protocol version the uC firmware is running.
1278        Based on that version, replaces PimuBase class inheritance with a inheritance to a child class of PimuBase that supports that protocol
1279        """
1280        PimuBase.startup(self, threaded=threaded)
1281        if self.hw_valid:
1282            if self.board_info['protocol_version'] in self.supported_protocols:
1283                Pimu.__bases__ = self.supported_protocols[self.board_info['protocol_version']]
1284                IMU.__bases__= self.imu.supported_protocols[self.board_info['protocol_version']]
1285            else:
1286                if self.board_info['protocol_version'] is None:
1287                    protocol_msg = """
1288                                    ----------------
1289                                    Failure in communications for {0} on startup.
1290                                    Please power cycle the robot and try again.
1291                                    ----------------
1292                                    """.format(self.name)
1293                else:
1294                    protocol_msg = """
1295                    ----------------
1296                    Firmware protocol mismatch on {0}.
1297                    Protocol on board is {1}.
1298                    Valid protocols are: {2}.
1299                    Disabling device.
1300                    Please upgrade the firmware and/or version of Stretch Body.
1301                    ----------------
1302                    """.format(self.name, self.board_info['protocol_version'], self.supported_protocols.keys())
1303                self.logger.warning(textwrap.dedent(protocol_msg))
1304                self.hw_valid = False
1305                self.transport.stop()
1306        if self.hw_valid:
1307            self.push_command()
1308            self.pull_status()
1309        return self.hw_valid
